A film that is definitely original, but the story is very muddled and never really concludes as it is open to a sequel but given the insanely poor box office it is a sequel we are unlikely to get. FIGHT OR FLIGHT totally surprised me. It blends over-the-top action with comedy, reminiscent of films like EVIL DEAD or SISU. While it initially presents as a serious action thriller, it quickly (and wonderfully) evolves into something unique and truly memorable. The lead performances pull you into the action seamlessly, and the film has a couple of shots that are totally iconic. One scene in particular features a character in a visually stunning altered state of consciousness that would have delighted Timothy Leary. A must-see for action fans looking for something totally different... and amazing!

Fight or Flight is messy, fun, and delivers exactly what it promises. The setup is solid, the action is chaotic in all the right ways, and Josh Hartnett sporting bleach blond hair and full dad-badass energy brings real charm to the role, especially doing his own stunts. But it’s far from flawless. The shaky cam is excessive, the final act feels like five different endings mashed together, and some of the dialogue sounds like it was written by a teenager who just discovered swearing. A few twists are also a bit too easy to see coming. Still, if you're in the mood for stylish nonsense with throwback energy and a leading man who knows how to own the chaos, it’s a fun ride just expect turbulence.

This movie was ridiculous, and a whole lot of fun! I avoid bloody flicks like the plague. But this was merry mayhem, with humor and a frontal attack on everything tame. Good thing they shot it before the FDA outlawed Red Dye #3! The characters were never to be taken seriously, just enjoyed for the nutty extravagances the plot weaved. I laughed a lot. You will too.

Highly recommended!

The worst movie I watched in 20 years

3.25/5.0 STARS - It's good to go into this with a healthy suspension of disbelief and the understanding that the film doesn't take itself too seriously. Feels like a better title for this movie would be "Assassins on a Plane" because that's encapsulates exactly what this story is about, and as you can imagine, the mayhem of the whole situation is a character in itself. Josh Hartnett shines in the role of Lucas Reyes, an ex-Secret Service agent who takes a mission that offers redemption and a possible pathway back to his former life. He's tasked with apprehending (and protecting) a cyberhacker/terrorist called "Ghost" who has boarded a plane for San Francisco. Unbeknownst to Reyes, most of his fellow plane passengers are assassins/bounty hunters who are also gunning for Ghost. What follows is a riotous adventure full of violence, hilarity, and a psychedelic drug trip. Worth watching for Harnett's performance alone. Video review: https://youtu.be/WirLWjK1zFY

The story is riddled with plot holes, so dont bother analyzing it. However, if you're watching purely for the action—just to see people brawl without worrying about the narrative—then this might be the movie for you."

This movie was a weird one. The premise itself is something that leads to a good action flick -exiled (and depressed/drunk) Secret Service Agent given one last escort mission to redeem himself and come home- but the execution is a little off keeping it from 4 stars. I think it was the pacing. Some of the comedy beats were true gold, IMO, like the Yoga class in the background of a scene or the senior pilot ragging on his junior for relying on a useless manual. The fight scenes themselves were also well done, with excellent choreography if one suspends their disbelief a bit. As Kung Pow: Enter the Fist would put it - that doesn't seem physically possible! Unfortunately, between the very fun action sequences (and are planes really that big on the inside, with that many secret compartments???) and visual gags there really is too much awkward silence to make this a must see. I will not be purchasing a copy, but if I saw Fight or Flight on TV I would probably let it run. There is one FANTASTIC comedy bit with 'toad venom', but I wouldn't want to spoil it.
A fun ride even though nothing new here. But its entertaining and Josh has fun with the role. Definitely worth a watch

But I think the movie lacks highly in action sequences and focuses too much on a story I could honestly care less for. The story is paced very awkwardly and other than Josh Hartnett’s character, the story and other characters were very lacklustre and brings the movie down with itself. The movie can be a lot of fun at times, but it just wasn’t for me so I recommend just streaming this one

Josh Hartnett brings the charm once again in Fight or Flight. While it’s another entry in the assassin movie genre, the film sets itself apart with humor, fast-paced action, and a few smart twists. Don’t expect something groundbreaking—just sit back, relax, and enjoy the ride. It’s pure fun.

This is a movie that achieved its purpose. It was funny, entertaining, charming and gruesome. It didn't try to send a message or create a heavy story line that required studying every line of dialogue, and yet these charming actors could, with a single tear, deliver emotion felt by the audience. I would love to see a sequel to this film. The audience deserves to see more of these characters and their continuing story!

Buckle Up for a Hight-Octane Ride James Madigan's Fight or Flight certainly delivers on its promise of high-octane action, throwing audiences headfirst into a claustrophobic battleground aboard a 16 hour flight. Fans craving the kinetic energy of films like Bullet Train will find plenty to enjoy here, with Josh Hartnett anchoring the chaos as disgraced agent Lucas Reyes. The action sequences themselves are undeniably fun. Madigan orchestrates a series of inventive and brutal confrontations within the confined spaces of the aircraft. From close-quarters combat in the aisles to resourceful weaponizing of everyday objects, the film keeps the adrenaline pumping. However, while Fight or Flight manages to keep its engines roaring on the action front, it unfortunately doesn't quite reach the cruising altitude of its more sophisticated cousin, Bullet Train. Where David Leitch's film excelled was in its razor-sharp dialogue and richly developed ensemble cast, each character with their own distinct quirks and compelling backstories. Fight or Flight, in contrast, feels somewhat less nuanced in these areas. Ultimately, Fight or Flight is a solid action thriller that will likely satisfy those looking for a thrill ride above the clouds. Josh Hartnett delivers a compelling lead performance, and the action is undeniably entertaining.
Action packed and lots of fun- can't wait for the sequel

"Fight or Flight" earns some points for being fully aware of what kind of movie it is. This is an over-the-top action movie that primarily takes place in one location, and it is an entertaining enough one at that. I do think there are actually a few recent movies with similar concepts that are better, "Bullet Train" and "Kill" to name a few recent ones that come to mind. That being said, this movie has enough action and comedy to make it a light viewing experience. The story has some intrigue, and the way it plays out is enjoyable enough. Overall, it is an okay action B-movie, but one that fully owns it, and I think more action movies should take this approach.

The movie was awful...I feel betrayed by the theater for charging me for the tickets and giving it credibility alongside decent movies. The hot dogs were so much better than the movie, albeit, pretty pricy. Hartnett and Chandran did a very nice job with a goofy script using Airplane as a base model and the Texas Chain Saw Murders as inspiration. Their chemistry was nice and they deserve credit for working so hard on an awful project. Our society is so past using the F bomb in EVERY sentence...that's what immature writers and directors use when they have no skills or talent and have a contract to fulfill...just use F in every sentence and sent it to the director to make it work.

So previously we saw Josh Hartnett is Trap (2024) and honestly originally I loved that film, since then we know M. Night Shyamalans next film is NOT a Trap 2 or a Trap sequel (unfortunately), we have been transformed into a Josh Hartnett action film. Honestly Fight or Flight isn't bad, it's filled with plenty of fake (and ugly) CGI blood, most of the jokes don't land well (for me) but the most silly ones (not meant to be funny) do. Josh Hartnett is absolutely hilarious in this film and the whole film is honestly so silly and I'm all here for it. The kills and overall action if pretty great considering the film constantly keeps you on your feet reminding you this is a action film. The film feels very similar to Killers Game (2024) that being the bounty and cool kills/comedy plot, but unfortunately for this film the plot is absolutely awful, but like I mentioned it's revived by it's just silly and mental action sequences. That ending is absolutely ridiculous and the last 10 minutes is just revolting.

The movie has a slow start but once it starts, it starts. Absolutely fantastic choreography and each action scene is better than the last. I'd argue that whoever planned the fight scenes attempted to show the main character warming up through the course of the film as he'd been in retirement for years by the beginning of the movie. As far as the story goes, the dialogue and world is your standard modern 2020s cliche stuff. It's somewhere in-between Beekeeper and Bullet Train, but I will say it doesn't lay on the social pandering too heavy and the movie doesn't take itself too seriously. All in all, fantastic movie.

“Fight or Flight” offers enough absurdity and mayhem to provide an enjoyably blood-filled flight despite its shortcomings weighing the experience down. This is the type of movie that aims to delight audiences with an undemanding yet enjoyable roller coaster of violent carnage and merciless chaos instead of being the next “John Wick”. Regarding its humdrum plot and runtime, this strategy may not be the perfect in-flight movie for everybody, including me. However, with the right mindset, it’s best seen as a watchable mid-afternoon streaming movie that benefits from Hartnett’s performance as the crazed, unconventional protagonist, the claustrophobic action scenes, and amusing humor. If a film that embraces its flawed and violently silly concept is what you seek, then “Fight or Flight” may be the trip worth taking. Everyone else may be better off riding a different plane to their destination.
Great movie. Very fun watch.

"Fight or Flight," a 2025 action film featuring Josh Hartnett, has some notable missteps that detract from the overall experience. First and foremost, the decision to give Hartnett blonde hair was a questionable choice; it feels like an attempt to make him appear younger, but instead, it just looks out of place. In his previous film, "Trap," he embodied a more mature character, and trying to reinvent him as a youthful hippie was a misguided endeavor. Additionally, his wardrobe throughout the movie was equally puzzling. The action sequences, however, were entertaining, set entirely aboard a plane. This quirky premise, with a mix of assassins and a ghostly presence, led to an all-out brawl that kept things lively. It’s important to note that this film leans heavily into the action-comedy genre, so it’s best not to take it too seriously. While the movie had its fun moments, I found it to be rather simplistic and lacking excitement. It felt as if it borrowed elements from various other films without adding any fresh creativity of its own. Hartnett’s performance was decent, but he often took a backseat to the other fighters, coming off more like a punching bag who, after sustaining significant injuries, somehow manages to bounce back thanks to an adrenaline shot. I have a strong suspicion that "Fight or Flight" will struggle at the box office. It lacks the energy and inventiveness needed to make a lasting impression. It ultimately feels flat and predictable, which leads to a viewing experience that is easily forgettable. In fact, after watching several films on the same day, I found it hard to recall this one, even having to look up its title to jog my memory. That’s the kind of impact this movie leaves—it’s likely to fade from viewers' minds soon after the credits roll.

The movie was TERRIBLE! STUPID, SENSELESS, NO REDEEMING VALUE. Josh Hartnet must be really hard up for movie roles to star in this waste-of-time Movie! There were 5 patrons in theater, 2 walked out in first half hour. I walked out after one hour. So glad I did not pay money for the ticket!

The movie was absolutely terrific—an exhilarating blend of fast-paced action and sharp, well-timed humor. I walked out of the theater grinning from ear to ear, still chuckling at some of the best lines.

I love scary movies, action, fantasy-type, and/or deeply disturbed slasher stories😳 it’s just a thing of mine💁🏻‍♀️ I went to see the new Josh Hartnett Fight or Flight movie and it was SO GOOD. It was over-the-top slaughter, like a Tarantino movie, but had a plot I could get into and similar dark humor that I felt Josh Hartnett nailed. Where has he been? Waaaaa... Watched this without even knowing much about it. BLEW ME AWAY!!! Honestly, it was just TOO MUCH FUN. Proper nostalgic vibes—took me straight back to the 90s when I used to munch on prawn crackers and watch wire-fu films after school. You know, those mad, blood gore sword fights? It's that sort of over-the-top, but it absolutely works. Josh Hartnett? Bruv, he’s ridiculously watchable, just nails the role like he was born for it. And then—get this—Marko Zaror shows up, and then Juju Chan as well?!! Mate, if you're into action films with real martial artists pulling off incredible fight sequences, this is next-level stuff. It’s like they added a sprinkle of authenticity just for the action nerds like me. The fight scenes? Absolutely sick. No exaggeration—it’s all flipping epic.

This film is sooo good. It’s a shot in the arm pure adrenaline from start to finish. The cast are amazing and I hope to see a sequel. It’s got potential with the dynamic duo Josh & Charithra. Bravo to the film crew and cast.

Fight or Flight is a 2025 action film directed by James Madigan ✈️ After an interesting, funny, and enjoyable first half, this all starts to take things a bit too far and gets silly… Not bad, but not my favourite either 😉 It’s ok, but I feel mixed about this one 😉 I’d recommend it if you like this genre, but if not then probably give it a miss 👍🏼👎🏼 A mercenary takes on the job of tracking down a target on a plane but must protect her when they're surrounded by people trying to kill both of them.

very good action flick and everybody does well. the josh guy is now a tough guy who could play these roles often. watch this you'll really like it.

So bad.. Hartnett has to pay the bills I suppose because he certainly didn't take this Job for the plot or any good writing. Annoying characters, poor shakecam fighting and 5ft girls whoopin 6ft beefcake assassins over a supercomputer that would tell the world about child forced labour. It's a shame because Hartnett is a good actor imo but not in this.

Absolutely loved it. Josh really brought fun to the role. And it's definately not about the story line, but the ride (or should I say flight) to the end. Not going to spoil it, but had a great time watching the movie.

It's basically Bullet Train set on a plane, Bullet Plane if you will, but it's shorter, gorier, more over the top and Josh Hartnett is a delight. The scene connected to a toad is one of the funniest things I've seen over the past couple of years.
John wick of the sky. Epic movie non stop. Josh harnett is great.

I need to review this as I left one for a shocking film I saw earlier this week. Fight or Flight is over the top, funny, bloody and non-sensical but it's a good watch. I see it as Bullet Train on steroids. Well worth a look!

Delightfully different and refreshingly fun. Crazy non-stop action comedy thriller, that just keeps going. Josh Harnett comes back to ours screens in outrageous fashion as a down on his luck ex secret service agent, just looking for a bit of peace and quiet but can’t seem to catch a break. Top notch 👌🏼
This is fun, full of fight scenes that have you squealing from the gore one minute to squealing with laughter the next! Great way to spend 90 minutes being entertained!
Дешево и сердито, Хартнетт повеселил, конечно это трешак, но гораздо бодрее, чем проходняки с Кейджем или Траволтой💣🔥

Josh Hartnett was outstanding. They should make more movies like this. Good thriller action and funny. I have to tell my friends and family about this movie. And I hope they put it on DVD. This movie is awesome. ⭐⭐⭐⭐
